Stores & Loading Dock Coordinator

Company Name Australian Turf Club Company Location Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 15 hours ago Number of views 1 view

Be an early applicant

Job description

Your ticket to a winning career


Australian Turf Club operates Sydney’s four racecourses; Royal Randwick, Warwick Farm, Rosehill Gardens and Canterbury Park. We provide world-class Thoroughbred racing all year round with Autumn and Spring Carnivals being our pinnacle showcase times for fashion, social and racing. When we aren’t racing we are a renowned award winning culinary, events and entertainment venue.

At Australian Turf Club ‘The Heart of Sydney Racing’ we believe our people are at the heart of everything we do. We are seeking candidates who are true team players, customer focused and thrive on meeting challenges. In return you will be rewarded with a unique, diverse and exciting employment experience.


About the role


This position reports directly to Executive Chef and is responsible for overseeing all activities at Royal Randwick loading dock and the cleaning and maintenance of equipment. Key to success will be will checking incoming goods against purchase orders and acting on any inconsistencies, ensuring that HACCP procedures are adhered to, ensuring loading dock quality control and secure storage, operating forklifts safely and monitoring par stock levels of dry goods and liquor.


ATC welcomes applications from individuals who meet the following criteria:


  • Minimum 2 years relevant experience in a similar role at a large catering, entertainment, or multi outlet complex or similar;
  • Strong working knowledge of HACCP principles;
  • Forklift experience, manitou experience desirable;
  • Valid forklift, NSW drivers license and RSA competency card;
  • Ability to work proactively to meet deadlines and set priorities;
  • Strong communication skills;
  • Must be available to work all racedays (primarily Saturdays).


What we offer


  • An opportunity to work in an award winning venue like no other.
  • Exposure to a fast paced team environment.
  • Opportunities to give back through participation in our community engagement volunteering program.
  • Staff Rewards and incentives – complimentary Race Day Member passes, discounts at major retailers and team social events.
  • Free onsite staff parking.

\xa0

Lawyer, Technology & Commercial

Company Name Australian Broadcasting Corporation (ABC) Company Location Sydney, AU

New Posted Date Posted 11 hours ago Number of views 29 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Lawyer, Technology & Commercial
  • Be a part of Australia's independent national broadcaster
  • Convenient CBD location in the heart of Ultimo (near Central Station)
  • Fixed-Term Vacancy for 12 months
  • $116K p.a. + choice of 15.4% super


About The ABC

The ABC is the nation's most trusted and independent source of Australian conversations, culture, and stories. With over 4,000 employees from diverse backgrounds, located across over 50 locations around Australia and overseas, we are proud to create, curate and deliver high-quality programming that informs, educates and entertains Australian communities.

About The Role

This is an excellent opportunity to join the ABC's in-house Legal department within the Technology, Commercial & Regulatory team for a 12 month fixed-term contract. Reporting to the Technology, Commercial & Regulatory Team Leader, you will:
  • Manage contract preparation, negotiation and general advice in relation to the acquisition of information technology, communications and electronic products and services for the ABC and commercialisation of the ABC's intellectual property.
  • Build and maintain strong working relationships both within Legal and with key managers across the ABC.
  • Work collaboratively with colleagues to share information, maintain an up to date understanding of business needs and priorities.


About You

The role requires someone with at least 4 years experience drafting and negotiating complex commercial contracts, ideally within the IT industry.
  • Relevant Legal Qualifications: admitted as a solicitor for a minimum of 6 years.
  • Ability to exercise good judgement and lead the negotiations on large scale acquisitions.
  • Knowledge of broadcasting legislation, privacy essential.
  • Aptitude to balance competing priorities, managing time and resources.

You'll have excellent interpersonal and communication skills and the ability to build strong relationships with managers at all levels and from a range of diverse backgrounds.

For an overview of the role, please refer to the position description: PD - Lawyer Technology and Commercial.docx

For further information contact Theoni Chryssan on (02) 8333 3351.

Recruitment Agency applications will not be accepted.

The ABC strives for equity and diversity in the workplace, and to promote a culture of opportunity. Through its services the ABC seeks to represent, connect and engage with all of the Australian community. In line with our focus on diversity, applications are strongly encouraged from Indigenous Australians, people from a range of cultural and linguistic backgrounds and people with disabilities. The ABC also aims to achieve a gender-balanced workforce.

Applications close: 17 Sep 2018 11:55 PM AUS Eastern Standard Time

Laundry Services Assistant

Company Name Carer Support & Respite Centre Inc. Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 3 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Sunshine North Location
  • Part Time Position (Saturday, 4 hours - 10.00 am to 14.00 pm)
  • Excellent Salary Packaging

The Laundry Services Assistant is responsible for providing a high quality laundry service in an effective and efficient way for the residents in our care in accordance with Villa Maria Catholic Homes’ vision, mission, values and continuous improvement systems.

Specifically, Your Key Responsibilities Will Include
  • Collect, sort, wash, dry and distribute clothing/linen
  • Maintain adequate stocks of supplies at all times
  • Ensure chemicals are available for washing and the correct wash cycle is used for all loads
  • Ensure heavily soiled items are handled in line with Infection Control Procedures


You Will Need To Demonstrate
  • Excellent interpersonal skills including the ability to communicate effectively and compassionately with residents, families, employees and volunteers; patience; common sense and an understanding of client service
  • Initiative and ability to work without supervision
  • Well-developed prioritisation and organisational skills with the ability to meet deadlines
  • Relevant experience working in a commercial laundry (desirable)
  • Relevant experience working in aged care, or an understanding of, and sensitivity to, the issues related to providing services to older people (desirable)


About Us

Through our passion and commitment to everyday people, Villa Maria Catholic Homes (VMCH) works in partnership with people of all ages and abilities. From all faiths and backgrounds, to achieve their goals, remain connected to their community and maintain independence.

We’re a Catholic not-for-profit organisation, providing services to 7,600 people across Victoria. Ask anyone at VMCH and you’ll find we’re driven by wanting to achieve outcomes that enhance the lives of older Australians, people with disability, families and carers.

We have a long history in listening to what people want and need. By making sure we can deliver services to match those needs, we can offer greater choice and opportunity to our customers. We want to help build compassionate and sustainable communities, so everyone is included.

Today we offer services that cover affordable housing options, residential aged care, retirement living, home community and disability services and specialist education. We’re an agile organisation constantly improving how we do things.

Our organisation is committed to being an employer of choice & provides employees with:
  • A Supportive Working Environment & Workplace Culture
  • Ongoing Professional Development & Career Pathways
  • Flexible Working Arrangements
  • Purposeful & Meaningful Work
  • Salary Packaging Benefits

To review the position description, please click the link below:

If you meet the above criteria and are passionate about making a positive difference in people’s lives, we would love to hear from you.

Applications close: Sunday, 23 September 2018 at 11:30pm

Permission to conduct a criminal records check and Evidence of Australian Work Rights will be required.

To work at Villa Maria Catholic Homes a current Working With Children Card is required.

If you have been a citizen or a permanent resident of a country other than Australia or have resided in an overseas country for 12 months or more in the last 10 years, you may need to provide a copy of your international police check before an offer of employment can be made.

864900891:
[

Social Media Engagement Specialist - 12 month contract

Company Name General Mills Company Location Mount Waverley, AU

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 8 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Company Description

General Mills is among the world’s leading food companies. Headquartered in the United States in Minnesota, General Mills, with over $15.6 billion in net sales and more than 41,000 employees worldwide, is the fifth largest food company in the world, marketing a portfolio of dynamic and trusted consumer brands across a wide range of food categories, holding No.1 or No. 2 market positions in virtually every category in which they compete.

Some of our most known global and regional brands are H\xe4agen-Dazs, Old El Paso, Green Giant, Nature Valley, Pillsbury, Yoplait, Betty Crocker, in addition to strong local brands such as Knack & Back in Germany, Jus-Rol in the United Kingdom, and Latina in Australia/NZ. Named one of the Top 100 Companies To Work For by Fortune Magazine, General Mills is also a multi award-winning employer across the globe, committed to talent development.

The Europe/Australasia region is the largest business in the International Division and is headquartered in Switzerland. It has an impressive track record of growth and is the fastest growing food company in many of the markets in which it operates.

Job Description

The Social Media Engagement Specialist monitors social media channels and engages with consumers to resolve issues, answer questions, and encourage excitement for our brands. Other responsibilities include monitoring for viral issues/hot topics, responding to website reviews & surprising consumers with Surprise and Delight packages. This person will be working a Sunday - Thursday shift.

Full time – Non-traditional business hours, including fluctuating schedule between 8 AM and 9 pm, Weekdays & some weekends. This is a 12 month fixed term contract.

Main Responsibilities
  • Monitors General Mills’ social media accounts in real-time and engage in conversations on behalf of General Mills brands when appropriate.
  • Follows the procedures for escalating and resolving consumer issues. Uses documents in Consumer Relations Knowledge Base to craft responses for consumers in the brand voice
  • Works with the Product Specialist, Team Supervisor and other Consumer Relations teams to resolve complex consumer issues.
  • Ensure compliance with all GMI Interactive Policies in matters relating to Blogging and Social media relationships and communications.

Competencies/Behaviors
  • Demonstrates strong interpersonal skills, bias for action, and attention to detail
  • Strong collaborator; able to quickly track down answers for community questions
  • Ability to be flexible and work with ambiguity; self-directed
  • Provide innovative thought leadership and advice to team and internal partners
  • Demonstrate strategic thinking skills in assessing and developing social media responses that have a positive impact, or minimize negative impact, on the brands and General Mills corporate

Qualifications

What sort of person do we need?
  • Experience 3 years preferably within social media & customer service in FMCG
  • Bachelor’s degree - preferrably in Business, Journalism, Communications, Marketing, or equivalent preferred
  • An autonomous self-starter with a proactive approach to work load management.
  • Consumer focused. Innovative. Flexible. Operationally and commercially minded.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Strong PC skills (including experience with Microsoft Office Suite), along with social media engagement experience

Additional Information

What will you get from us?
  • We have a very flexible, employee-focussed culture with a great work environment
  • Benefits such as staff discount on Latina, Betty Crocker, Old El Paso and Nature Valley
  • We will look for ways to help you grow your skill set through cross-functional career opportunities and stretch assignments
  • We invest in both your professional and personal development
  • At General Mills, our mission and our values are our strategy for success and our people are the key ingredients in bringing them to life. If you are ready to fulfill your potential and share your talents with the outstanding people of General Mills please click “I'm interested” below.
Privacy Policy

Entry level

  • Food & Beverages
  • Consumer Goods

  • Public Relations
  • Writing/Editing

We stand by the few who suffer from rare diseases and the millions with long-term chronic conditions.

The Human Resources team supports all five divisions of Sanofi across Australia and New Zealand, namely Consumer Healthcare, General Medicines, Rare Diseases, Diabetes & Cardiovascular and Vaccines. We are proud to be awarded the prestigious AHRI Rob Goffee Award for Leadership Development in 2016. We were also finalists in 2017 for Australian HR Team of the Year.

We have a superb opportunity for an HR & Shared Business Services Administrator to join our collaborative and close-knit team.
